intro: Galium stellatum subsp. eremicum, commonly known as desert starweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as deserts and rocky soils. The plant features small, star-shaped white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a hairy texture, adapting to reduce water loss in dry conditions. The species is part of the Rubiaceae family, known for its diverse and often ornamental members.
